results.name: Cloud Run hosting decision
results.answer: The decision to use Cloud Run for API hosting was made because it scales to zero when idle, which keeps costs near zero during development [N1]. The service also auto-scales up to 10 instances under load [N1]. The backend uses TypeScript with Express.js [N5]. The deployment process involves merging

results.name: Chunk size configuration
results.answer: The target chunk size is 450 characters with 75 character overlap [N1][N2]. This chunk size was determined after testing different sizes, and it had the best retrieval accuracy at 87% [N2]. The tested chunk sizes were 200, 400, 600, and 800 characters [N2]. Sentence-aware splitting is used to preser

results.name: Rate limit configuration
results.answer: The production API has rate limits of 60 requests per minute per tenant [N1]. The chat endpoint has a 30 second timeout [N1]. The maximum query length is 2000 characters [N1]. The system uses in-memory rate limiting with a sliding window algorithm [N1].

results.name: Sprint 1 target date
results.answer: The target launch date for the MVP is January 15, 2025 [N2]. Sprint 1 goals include completing the MVP with basic notes CRUD, simple search, and a chat endpoint [N2]. results.answer: The pricing strategy will be $9.99/month for Pro [N1], with a free tier limited to 100 notes [N1]. The target users are researchers, students, and writers [N1]. results.name: RAG implementation details
results.answer: The retrieval system in the RAG pipeline uses hybrid search, combining vector similarity (cosine) with keyword matching [N1]. results.name: Competitor comparison
results.answer: Our advantage is simplicity and citation transparency [N1][N5]. Competitors include Notion AI, which uses GPT-4 [N1] and costs $10/user/month [N1]. Mem.ai focuses on memory graph [N1] and costs $15/month [N1]. Obsidian Copilot is local-first [N1] and has a one-time cost of $50 [N1]. We chose Cloud R

results.name: Risk and mitigation
results.answer: The main risks for the project are API cost overruns, user adoption, and competition [N1]. These risks are being mitigated through strict rate limits, a freemium model, and a focus on simplicity as a differentiator [N1].
